citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
An individual at the facility informed the inspector that the licensee was out of state in order to set up a multiday exhibition
that would be starting the next when the inspector arrived at the facility. The inspector reached the licensee by phone and
determined that the licensee had not submitted the required written itinerary to USDA Animal Care for the last minute
engagement accepted the previous day. Submission of a written itinerary is required in advance of any travel in order to
allow USDA Animal Care to be able to track to inspect the animals regulated under the Animal Welfare Act and
Regulations.
The facility shall submit a written itinerary including all the required information to USDA Animal Care (email
animalcare@usda.gov) at least two days in advance (or if the exhibitor accepts an engagement for which travel will begin
with less than 48 hours notice, the exhibitor shall notify Animal Care immediately) of any overnight travel for exhibition of
any animal at any location other than the person's approved site. A copy of the Itinerary Form was emailed to the
licensee. Correct by 9/27/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.126(c) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
An individual at the facility informed the inspector that the licensee was out of state in order to set up a multiday exhibition 
that would be starting the next when the inspector arrived at the facility. The inspector reached the licensee by phone and 
determined that the licensee had not submitted the required written itinerary to USDA Animal Care for the last minute 
engagement accepted the previous day. Submission of a written itinerary is required in advance of any travel in order to 
allow USDA Animal Care to be able to track to inspect the animals regulated under the Animal Welfare Act and 
Regulations.  
The facility shall submit a written itinerary including all the required information to USDA Animal Care (email 
animalcare@usda.gov) at least two days in advance (or if the exhibitor accepts an engagement for which travel will begin 
with less than 48 hours notice, the exhibitor shall notify Animal Care immediately) of any overnight travel for exhibition of 
any animal at any location other than the person's approved site. A copy of the Itinerary Form was emailed to the 
licensee. Correct by 9/27/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
